prague.title: Prague
prague.tagline: The City of a Hundred Spires
prague.gettingThere: Fly to Vaclav Havel Airport (PRG) — major hub with direct flights from most European cities. 30-minute bus or taxi to city center.

essentials.gettingAround: Metro, tram, and bus system is excellent. 24-hour pass ~110 CZK (~$5). Walking is best for Old Town.
essentials.language: Czech, English widely spoken in tourist areas

budapest.title: Budapest
budapest.gettingThere: Fly to Budapest Ferenc Liszt Airport (BUD). Bus 100E to city center (~35 min, 2,200 HUF). Or train connections from Vienna (2.5 hr), Prague (6.5 hr).
highlights: Ruin bars of the Jewish Quarter

essentials.gettingAround: Metro, trams, and buses. 24-hour travel card ~2,500 HUF (~$7). Tram 2 along the Danube is scenic.

krakow.title: Krakow
krakow.gettingThere: Fly to John Paul II Airport (KRK) — budget airlines from across Europe. Train from Warsaw (2.5 hr) or Prague (7 hr).

essentials.gettingAround: Old Town is compact and walkable. Trams for longer trips. Uber and Bolt available.

dubrovnik.title: Dubrovnik
dubrovnik.gettingThere: Fly to Dubrovnik Airport (DBV). Airport shuttle bus 30 min to Old Town (~40 HRK). Ferry from Split or Bari (Italy).
highlights: Walk the city walls (2 km loop)

essentials.gettingAround: Old Town is pedestrian-only. Local buses connect Lapad and Gruz. Water taxis to nearby islands.
trainConnections: No rail — bus to Split (4.5 hr, ~$15)

split.title: Split
split.gettingThere: Fly to Split Airport (SPU). Bus 37 to city center (30 min, ~30 HRK). Major ferry hub for Croatian islands.

essentials.gettingAround: Old Town is walkable. Local buses and ferries from the Riva. Uber available.

ljubljana.title: Ljubljana
ljubljana.gettingThere: Fly to Ljubljana Joze Pucnik Airport (LJU). Bus to center (45 min, ~4 EUR). Train from Vienna (6 hr) or Zagreb (2.5 hr).

essentials.gettingAround: Very walkable and bike-friendly. BicikeLJ bike-share system. Buses for outskirts.

bratislava.title: Bratislava
bratislava.gettingThere: Fly to Bratislava Airport (BTS) or use nearby Vienna Airport (VIE, 1 hr by bus). Frequent trains from Vienna (1 hr), Budapest (2.5 hr), Prague (4 hr).

essentials.gettingAround: Compact Old Town easily walked. Trams and buses for wider city. Day trip to Vienna easy.

bucharest.title: Bucharest
bucharest.tagline: The Little Paris of the East
bucharest.gettingThere: Fly to Henri Coanda Airport (OTP). Express bus 783 to city center (~40 min, 3.50 RON). Direct flights from most European capitals.
highlights: Palace of the Parliament — world's heaviest building
Day trip to Bran Castle (Dracula's Castle)
Caru' cu Bere historic beer hall

essentials.gettingAround: Metro system covers the city well. Uber and Bolt widely used. Old Town is walkable.

sofia.title: Sofia
sofia.tagline: 2,000 Years of History at Your Feet
sofia.gettingThere: Fly to Sofia Airport (SOF). Metro line M4 to city center (~20 min, 1.60 BGN). Budget airline hub.

essentials.gettingAround: Metro, trams, and buses. Single ticket 1.60 BGN (~$0.90). Center is walkable.

belgrade.title: Belgrade
belgrade.tagline: Where East Meets West at the Confluence
belgrade.gettingThere: Fly to Belgrade Nikola Tesla Airport (BEG). Bus A1 to city center (~30 min, 300 RSD). Train connections from Budapest (8 hr).

essentials.gettingAround: Buses, trams, trolleybuses. BusPlus card required. Center walkable. Taxi apps: CarGo, Yandex.

tallinn.title: Tallinn
tallinn.tagline: Medieval Fairy Tale on the Baltic
tallinn.gettingThere: Fly to Tallinn Airport (TLL) — 15 min tram ride to Old Town. Ferry from Helsinki (2 hr). Bus from Riga (4.5 hr).

essentials.gettingAround: Old Town is compact and walkable. Trams and buses for outer areas. Bolt ride-hailing popular.

riga.title: Riga
riga.gettingThere: Fly to Riga International Airport (RIX). Bus 22 to city center (~30 min, ~2 EUR). Ryanair and Wizz Air hub.

essentials.gettingAround: Trams, buses, trolleybuses. Old Town walkable. Bolt available. e-scooters in summer.

vilnius.title: Vilnius
vilnius.gettingThere: Fly to Vilnius Airport (VNO) — 15 min bus ride to Old Town. Budget airline hub with Ryanair and Wizz Air.
highlights: Vilnius Old Town (UNESCO, largest in Europe)

essentials.gettingAround: Old Town very walkable. Buses and trolleybuses. Bolt ride-hailing. Bike-friendly city.

travelTips.currency: Mixed currencies. EUR used in Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Slovakia, Slovenia. Local currencies: CZK (Czech), HUF (Hungary), PLN (Poland), HRK (Croatia), RON (Romania), BGN (Bulgaria), RSD (Serbia). Cards widely accepted.
travelTips.visaFree: EU/Schengen zone for most destinations. Non-EU citizens: check Schengen 90-day rule. Serbia is non-Schengen but visa-free for most nationalities.
travelTips.bestOverallMonths: May to September for warm weather. December for Christmas markets. April and October for shoulder season value.
travelTips.winterNote: Cold winters (Nov-Mar) but magical Christmas markets in Prague, Budapest, Krakow, Tallinn, and Riga.
travelTips.simCard: EU roaming makes one SIM work across most destinations. Buy a Vodafone, T-Mobile, or local SIM at any airport for ~$10-15/month.
travelTips.transport: FlixBus and RegioJet connect most cities affordably. Trains excellent in Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland. Budget flights via Ryanair and Wizz Air.
